name: property-skip-trace-async
title: Property Skip Trace Async | BatchData

endpoint.path:
Property Skip Trace Async
post
https://api.batchdata.com/api/v1/property/skip-trace/async

This is the asynchronous version of the Property Skip Trace API endpoint.

Async Request Pattern:

The HTTP response returns immediately with only a status object indicating the request was accepted
Full results are delivered asynchronously to the webhookUrl specified in the request options
The webhook payload will contain the complete response matching the synchronous Property Skip Trace endpoint format

Use of the asynchronous API endpoint is recommended when processing large batches of requests. Refer to 'BatchData API Rate Limits' for more details.

Each record returned in the webhook payload counts as a billable API request.

V1 TCPA Filtering Behavior: By default (when includeTCPABlacklistedPhones=false or not specified), V1 filters out phone numbers with TCPA restrictions. To include TCPA-restricted phones with a 'tcpa' boolean attribute for programmatic filtering, set includeTCPABlacklistedPhones to true in the request options.

Request
Headers
Authorization
string
required

Enter "Bearer" followed by the API Token

Example:
Bearer [40 digit API token]
Body
application/json
application/json

Owner contact information for a property (skip trace) can be retrieved by either passing the address or the assessor’s parcel number (APN).

When skip tracing a property by address, the following combination of request parameters must be used with the propertyAddress request object:

• street, city, state, zip

• street, zip

• street, city, state

When skip tracing a property by assessor’s parcel number, the following combination of parameters must be used:

• apn, county, state

• apn, countyFipsCode

Refer to the examples for more details on usage.

An object containing the requested properties and options to control request processing and response formatting.

requests
array[object]

An array of skip trace requests

propertyAddress
object

The address of the property to skip trace.

mailingAddress
object

The mailing address of the property owner.

name
object

By default the skiptrace api will automatically determine the owner’s name and will return the contact information for the property owner. It is also possible to override this behavior and influence what contact information is returned by passing the name of a person. If the person is confirmed to be associated with the property, that person’s contact information will be returned. Otherwise the contact information for the property owner will be returned.

apn
string

The Assessor parcel Number

countyFipsCode
string

A 5-digit numbers code which uniquely identifies counties and county equivalents in the United States

county
string

The property county

state
string

The state abbreviation (e.g. IL)

requestId
string

A request ID used to correlate responses with requests. For example, if you set the request ID of a property to "1234" then you would see "1234" as the request ID of the matching response.

options
object

The request options that control request processing and response formatting

includeTCPABlacklistedPhones
boolean

A flag controlling whether phone numbers flagged as TCPA/blacklisted are included in the response.Show all...

showRequests
boolean

A flag indicating whether the original request data should be returned in the response object

webhookUrl
string

A webhook URL to which the response object should be sent (asynchronous requests only)

errorWebhookUrl
string

An error webhook URL to which the error details should be sent (asynchronous requests only)

dateFormat
string

A flag indicating whether date format should be datetime or date only

Example:
iso-date-time,iso-date
Responses
200

500

Async Request Pattern:

The HTTP response returns immediately with only a status object indicating the request was accepted

Use of the asynchronous API endpoint is recommended when processing large batches of requests. Refer to 'BatchData API Rate Limits' for more details.

endpoint.path:
Property Search Async
post
https://api.batchdata.com/api/v1/property/search/async

This is the asynchronous version of the Property Search API endpoint.

Async Request Pattern:

The HTTP response returns immediately with only a status object indicating the request was accepted
Full results are delivered asynchronously to the webhookUrl specified in the request options
The webhook payload will contain the complete response matching the synchronous Property Search endpoint format

Use of the asynchronous API endpoint is recommended when processing large batches of requests. Refer to 'BatchData API Rate Limits' for more details.

Each record returned in the webhook payload counts as a billable API request.

Request
Headers
Authorization
string
required

Enter "Bearer" followed by the API Token

Body
application/json
application/json

The request consists of an address

An object containing the search criteria and options to control request processing and response formatting.

searchCriteria
object
required

An object containing property search criteria. Multiple search criteria are combined using an AND operation.

query
string
required

The query string is used to provide a partial USPS address which can be combined with other search criteria to narrow search results to a particular region. For example, searchCriteria.query = "Phoenix, AZ" when combined with other search criteria will limit results to the properties in Phoenix Arizona.

quickList
string

A named query that will execute a search based on business rules. Valid values are absentee-owner, active-auction, active-listing, canceled-listing, cash-buyer, corporate-owned, expired-listing, failed-listing, fix-and-flip, free-and-clear, for-sale-by-owner, has-hoa, has-hoa-fees, high-equity, inherited, in-state-absentee-owner, listed-below-market-price, low-equity, mailing-address-vacant, notice-of-default, notice-of-lis-pendens, notice-of-sale, on-market, out-of-state-absentee-owner, out-of-state-owner, owner-occupied, pending-listing, preforeclosure, recently-sold, same-property-and-mailing-address, tax-default, tired-landlord, unknown-equity, vacant, vacant-lot. Use "not-" prefix to exclude the quicklist (e.g "not-owner-occupied")

quickLists
array[string]

An array of named queries that will execute searches based on business rules. Valid values are absentee-owner, active-auction, active-listing, canceled-listing, cash-buyer, corporate-owned, expired-listing, failed-listing, fix-and-flip, free-and-clear, for-sale-by-owner, has-hoa, has-hoa-fees, high-equity, inherited, involuntary-lien, in-state-absentee-owner, listed-below-market-price, low-equity, mailing-address-vacant, notice-of-default, notice-of-lis-pendens, notice-of-sale, on-market, out-of-state-absentee-owner, out-of-state-owner, owner-occupied, pending-listing, preforeclosure, recently-sold, same-property-and-mailing-address, tax-default, tired-landlord, unknown-equity, vacant, vacant-lot. Property Lookup Async
post
https://api.batchdata.com/api/v1/property/lookup/async

This is the asynchronous version of the Property Lookup API endpoint.

Async Request Pattern:

The HTTP response returns immediately with only a status object indicating the request was accepted
Full property results are delivered asynchronously to the webhookUrl specified in the request options
The webhook payload will contain the complete response matching the synchronous Property Lookup endpoint format

Use of the asynchronous API endpoint is recommended when retrieving large amounts of property records. Refer to 'BatchData API Rate Limits' for more details.

Each property record returned in the webhook payload counts as a billable API request. The results meta object provides a breakdown of the total number of properties that match the search criteria as well the number of properties returned in the response. 'resultCount' indicates the number of returned properties that will be billed. Additional costs apply if the request options includes contact enrichment ("skipTrace": true). 'skipTraceMatchCount' indicates the number of properties with matched contact information.

street, city, state, zip

To retrieve information about a property using the property’s parcel number, provide values for

apn, address.state, address.county

or

apn, address.state, countyFipsCode

An object containing the requested properties and options to control request processing and response formatting.
